content: We are using the ExplanationOfBenefit Resource and in need of a placeholder for the ‘check number’ when the claim has been paid. Can someone confirm if the ExplanationOfBenefit.payment.identifier (Identifier of the payment instrument) would be a valid option? Also, would it be appropriate to extend the Identifier Type Codes and add a value such a CHK (Code) Check Number (Display)? According to the FHIR specifications, this Identifier is a ‘business’ identifier.
Did you think that was a serious question? Sorry, it is friday afternoon here...
@Paul Knapp Is there an FM meeting today?
Thanks, Paul. This is my first time posting anything in Zulip. Thanks, John for keeping it light. I have lots more questions to come and I'm very new with FHIR.
Welcome to the list Susan don't be bashful, many of the people on the list are new to FHIR
Thanks, Andy. I'm working on that bashful part. :-)
This was an amusing thread on a Saturday morning :-)

@Paul Knapp Hi Paul. This is a follow-up question regarding the use of ExplanationOfBenefit.payment.identifier for the check number. We have recently discovered there can be multiple check numbers for a given claim that need to be stored. The ExplanationOfBenefit.payment has a cardinality of 0..1 and doesn't allow for multiple check numbers. Is this something I would need to request via gForge to get the cardinality changed to 0..*?

@Susan Crawford Paul is currently vacationing and may not see your message. I think it is very reasonable to submit a GForge tracker with your request, so that FM can address it in an upcoming teleconference (and to make sure it doesn't get lost)
Thank you Andy. I hope Paul is having a great vacation.
Yes, please create a tracker item for this.
